
{{alias}}( obj[, options] )
    Inverts an object, such that keys become values and values become keys.

    Parameters
    ----------
    obj: ObjectLike
        Input object.

    options: Object (optional)
        Options.

    options.duplicates: boolean (optional)
        Boolean indicating whether to store duplicate keys. Default: `true`.

    Returns
    -------
    out: Object
        Inverted object

    Examples
    --------
    > var out = {{alias}}({
    >     'a': 'beep',
    >     'b': 'boop'
    > })
    { 'beep': 'a', 'boop': 'b'}
    > out = {{alias}}({
    >     'a': 'beep',
    >     'b': 'beep'
    > })
    {'beep':['a','b']}
    > var obj = {};
    > obj.a = 'beep';
    > obj.b = 'boop';
    > obj.c = 'beep'; // inserted after `a`
    > out = {{alias}}( obj, {
    >     'duplicates': false
    > });
    { 'beep': 'c', 'boop': 'b' }

    See Also
    --------
